reviews.text: Hi,
reviews.title: THE REVIEW

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have just got back from the Lanzasur Club Bungalows and after spending 2 weeks there I will give you an exact detailed review.
reviews.title: Value for money - give it a go!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The dates we stayed were from the 17th September to the 1st October 2009.
reviews.title: LOVELY HOTEL, GREAT LOCATION

reviews.text: On the holiday there was me, my partner & my 14 month old daughter.
reviews.title: Clean and relaxed!

reviews.text: As we pulled upto the hotel it looks really nice and looks like a 4 star hotel. Inside is very nice and clean with lots of plants and a small bridge at the bottom with fish in the water, the reception area is very nice with lots of comfy chairs and the receptionist could speak very good English.
reviews.title: dont go unless you're german

reviews.text: We were moved here after our original hotel had been overbooked. It was very clean, pool area very good. Food good.....but the hotel was predominantly German. Kids club was geared towards Germans, they even showed a dvd in German. The evening entertainment was poor and again in German. We moved after 2 nights.
reviews.title: 90% German

reviews.text: You stay in compact bungalows which have a small lounge/kitchen, this also contains a sofa bed but this is only suitable for small children. The kitchen has fridge, sink,electric hobs and crockery,coffee maker but no kettle. There is also a wall mounted flat screen TV which you need to pay if you choose to view, and a hairdrier in the bathroom. As stated in previous reviews there is no air con and it is necessary to hire a fan from reception for £10 euros , also we slept with the bedroom window open. The bungalows each have their own patio which was a bonus. Yes there are ants but they didn't bother
reviews.title: family hotel value for money

reviews.text: us a a spray of "jungle Formula" kept them away. The hotel is clean and the maid cleaned or bungalow and provided clean towles every day,( just put the dirty ones in the bath). Some mornings the hotel sprays insecticide around the pools/garden area maybe this is why we didn't see any cockroaches or any other crawlies. The food was ok, not thebest quality meat and when there was bacon for breakfast it was not very
reviews.title: fabulous

reviews.text: good. There is a kiddies disco each evening from 8.30 - 9.00ish which is held outside
reviews.title: You get what you pay for!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: away from the restaurant , then the evening entertainment held inside for from 9.30 to 10.30ish. The drinks were fine, self service for coffee & soft drinks which were avilable all day. Ther is no 4* star luxury here but If you want a hotel on a budget stay here, especially if you have young children. Teenages may get bored as there is not a lot for them. Taxi to the marina is 4 euros worth a visit, Playa Flamingo is about a 10 minute walk with rock pools and a sandy beach. We enjoyed our holiday, it was worth the money and we love Playa Blanca and will return but I am afraid not to the Lanzasur.
reviews.title: Excellent Value For Money

reviews.text: We went away for a week all inclusive (9 in total) we had 3 bungalows near each other. The accomodation was fine, although if there is 3 adults sleeping in one bungalow the third will be sleeping in the kitchen/lounge which isnt ideal.
reviews.title: excellent complex

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The facilities were excellent 4 pools, games room, shop on site, evening entertainment every night, bowling, gym, crazy golf, tennis courts and kids entertainment. The staff are welcoming and friendly and helped us with any questions we had. The food on offer was varied for every meal and very nice, drinks available to help urself too.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't want to leave after a week, would without doubt recommend the hotel.
reviews.title: Nothing wrong with it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a week all inclusive with A1 Travel from Teletext Holidays. This is the second year running we have booked with A1 and we would certainly recommend them for a well organised break on a budget.
reviews.title: IDEAL ACCOMODATION IF YOU LIKE GERMANS!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Lanzasur Club is on the 'second row' from the promenade, and consists of a number of bugalows, which, as far as we could tell, were all equipped for self catering. This meant that even though we were all inclusive, we had the benefit of a fridge, crockery, etc.. Bungalow had bathroom, bedroom and lounge/kitchen with sofa bed. LCD TV, but only CNN and Eurosport in English. Everywhere was clean and as it should be, but a very noisy plastic sheet protecting the bed took a little getting used to!!
reviews.title: Relaxing but room for improvement

reviews.text: We stayed here over christmas and the hotel was suitable for our needs, we had a 2 year old with us. Rooms were ok, could have been slightly bigger but least there was a separate bedroom. Short walk down a hill to the beach and some restaurants and a couple of supermarkets, about a 15-20 minute walk to the main area of Playe Blanca. The hotel had a heated pool as promised but it was still rather chilly for our 2 year old. Would go back to Playa Blanca but maybe look to stay closer to Play Blanca but I would stay here again for a good deal.
reviews.title: Decent hotel for the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Disappointed us Brits weren't treated as well as the Germans. Entertainment was mainly in German and terrible. Food not too bad if you liked pork and fish. Bathrooms dangerous as baths slippery with no grab handle. Too many kids for my liking, running riot with parents who could'nt care less as long as they weren't being bothered. The beds were very hard and you were only given a bolster, no pillows. No snacks in between meals, only a piece of cake. Not worth the price we paid, as only a 3*. Playa Blanca a nice place though.
reviews.title: Don't know what to say

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited 21-28 Nov 2010.
reviews.title: Lanzasur Club. A good base, worth a visit

reviews.text: Nicely laid out hotel sheltering your poolside bathing from the regular winds. Accommodation was fine, cleaned regularly and not too far from facilities.
reviews.title: Quiet, relaxing hotel with lovely pool

reviews.text: The food was excellent, plentiful, hot & fresh and varied, especially lunch and dinner. Suitable even for vegetarians, if you are that way inclined! We read previous reviews that were not overly complimentary about the food. If you want English breakfast, go buy it elsewhere for between 2.50 - 4.50. You are in Lanzarote which is Spanish. The menu varied daily albeit some items were consistant eg chips. Look beyond that and try stuff, it's there. The only slight downer was that some of the drinks machines ran out or the cups/glasses and they were not perhaps on the ball quick enough. Daytime snacks, if you needed them, were not the freshest of crisps so don't expect a just opened bag of Walkers. You shouldnt be hungry anyway. There are numerous local bars, cafe, restuarants if you want them.
reviews.title: Really enjoyed it!!
